name: British Music
description: Music of Great Britain, including the music of the English, Welsh and Scottish people.

children.name: Ballad Opera
children.description: English reaction to the Italian Opera styles with a satirical sense of humor and scores borrowing from Traditional Folk Music and popular music.

children.name: British Brass Band
children.description: An ensemble consisting of a standardized range of brass and percussion instruments whose performances are based on the British tradition established in the early 19th century.

children.name: British Dance Band
children.description: Came from the dancehalls of the 1920s and 1930s, combining a British take on Jazz with the Music Hall tradition.

children.name: British Folk Rock
children.description: Developed in the late 1960s; influenced by traditional British folk music, particularly English Folk Music.

children.name: Change Ringing
children.description: English tradition of ringing tuned bells in accordance with mathematically-derived patterns, creating a distinctive cascading effect.

children.name: Concertina Band
children.description: Ensemble consisting of concertinas of various pitches and percussion instruments originating in 19th-century England.

children.name: Contenance angloise
children.description: Distinct style of Polyphonic Chant developed in fifteenth-century England.

children.name: Cornish Folk Music
children.description: Musical traditions developed by the Cornish people, mainly found in the county of Cornwall in South West England.

children.name: English Folk Music
children.description: Musical traditions of the English people, primarily divided into dance music and folksongs.

children.name: English Pastoral School
children.description: Early 20th-century English classical composers turning to English folk and pastoral influences.

children.name: Music Hall
children.description: British theatrical entertainment popular in the 19th and 20th centuries, featuring light and comedic popular songs.

children.name: Sarum Chant
children.description: Latin Plainsong tradition of Salisbury, England, characterized by its unadorned simplicity.

children.name: Scottish Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of the Scottish people.
